question.title: What will inflation in the UK be, given Liz Truss wins the Conservative Party leadership candidate contest? (2025)
question.description:
*Related Question on Metaculus:*

* [What will inflation in the UK be, given Rishi Sunak wins the Conservative Party leadership candidate contest?](https://www.metaculus.com/questions/11946/inflation-if-rishi-sunak-wins/)

* [What will the GDP of the UK be (in billions GBP), given Rishi Sunak wins the Conservative Party leadership contest?](https://www.metaculus.com/questions/11959/gdp-if-rishi-sunak-wins/)

* [What will the GDP of the UK be (in billions GBP), given Liz Truss wins the Conservative Party leadership contest?](https://www.metaculus.com/questions/11965/gdp-if-liz-truss-wins/)

----

The United Kingdom is experiencing a cost-of-living-crisis, which the Office of National Statistics [primarily attributes](https://www.ons.gov.uk/economy/inflationandpriceindices/bulletins/consumerpriceinflation/latest#notable-movements-in-prices) to increases in the prices of motor fuels and food.  Motor fuel prices increased by 42% in June 2022 compared to 12 months prior, and food and non-alcoholic beverages prices increased by 10% in the same period, according to [ONS](https://www.ons.gov.uk/economy/inflationandpriceindices/bulletins/consumerpriceinflation/latest#notable-movements-in-prices). With growth in regular pay (excluding bonuses) at 4.3% from [March to May 2022](https://www.ons.gov.uk/employmentandlabourmarket/peopleinwork/employmentandemployeetypes/bulletins/averageweeklyearningsingreatbritain/latest#main-points-for-march-to-may-2022), many Britons are struggling with expenses.

The ongoing Conservative Party leadership election will determine the next leader of the Conservative Party and therefore the next Prime Minister of the United Kingdom. Only two candidates are left: Rishi Sunak and Liz Truss. Results are expected by [September 5, 2022](https://www.theguardian.com/politics/2022/jul/11/britain-new-pm-5-september-tory-leadership-rules-announced).

`{"format":"metac_closes_in_period","info":{"post_id":11952,"question_id":11956}}`
question.resolution_criteria:
This question is a subquestion of a group question. This subquestion specifically pertains to (and resolves according to) the option '2025'. The resolution criteria for the parent question is below. 

If Liz Truss does not win the UK Conservative Party leadership election in 2022, all of the following questions will resolve as **Ambiguous**.

Otherwise, these questions will resolve as the annual inflation rate of the Consumer Prices Index including owner occupiers' housing costs (CPIH) for the respective calendar years, according to the United Kingdom's [Office of National Statistics](https://www.ons.gov.uk/economy/inflationandpriceindices/bulletins/consumerpriceinflation/latest).  For example, the annual inflation rate in 2021 was 2.49%, according to ONS.
question.fine_print:
If estimates from UK ONS are not available, an alternative source may be selected, or the question may resolve as **Ambiguous** at the discretion of Metaculus Admins

***
This question's information (resolution criteria, fine print, background info, etc) is synced with an [original identical question](https://www.metaculus.com/questions/11952) which opened on 2022-07-29 05:00:00. This question will resolve based on the resolution criteria and fine print contained above. However, if this question would resolve differently than the original question, then this question will be annulled. Additionally, if the original question's resolution could have been known before this question opened, then this question will be annulled.
question.short_title: UK Inflation if Liz Truss Wins
